materials.raw_text:
1. Arsenic Trioxide (As2O3) - 40 g 
 2. Iron(III) Oxide (Fe2O3) - 120 g 
 3. Manganese Dioxide (MnO2) - 30 g 
 4. Sodium Carbonate (Na2CO3) - 10 g 
 5. Distilled Water - 50 mL

sourcing.instructions:
1. Arsenic Trioxide can be sourced from chemical supply companies or online specialty suppliers. 
 2. Iron(III) Oxide can be found at hardware stores or chemical suppliers. 
 3. Manganese Dioxide can be obtained from chemical supply stores or online. 
 4. Sodium Carbonate can be purchased at grocery stores or chemical suppliers. 
 5. Distilled Water is available at supermarkets or pharmacies.

preparation.raw_text:
1. In a clean glass container, combine 40 g of Arsenic Trioxide and 120 g of Iron(III) Oxide. 
 2. Add 30 g of Manganese Dioxide to the mixture. 
 3. Slowly add 10 g of Sodium Carbonate while stirring continuously to ensure even distribution. 
 4. Gradually add 50 mL of Distilled Water to the mixture while stirring to form a slurry. 
 5. Mix thoroughly until a homogenous paste is achieved.
